page.title: 15Copse Green Farm
page.content: The Lewis's own 250 pigs, 110 cattle, 2 geese,2 horses,some hens and 150 acres of corn.Most of the pigs are Large Whites,they keep a few Gloucester Old Spots.Some pigs are kept for breeding,most are sold. Piglets are born in May or June.They stay in a small pen for 6 weeks,then are placed in mixed pens with other sows and piglets.If the mother does not look after the piglets then she is sold as meat.When the piglets are 6 months old they are separated from the sow to be sold as bacon and pork. Fresians and Hereford Crosses are also kept.Calves feed from their mothers and are weened off after 6 weeks.The Lewis's made silage for the first time this year.This is kept until winter and then fed to the animals.
